title: Rain, rain, go away
body:
Dad and I were scheduled to continue working on the Cinebar tonight, but we ran out of materials, and, thanks to rain, were unable to go buy more. So tonight's work-a-thon was cut short. Damn. On the bright side, I have three great pieces of news:

1. Our second HVAC bid came in... $10,500. Woo hoo! That's $10,000 less than the original bid!

2. The electrical bid is still being reconfigured, but it looks like it's going to come in around the $20K mark. Again, a savings of roughly $10,000! Of course, it should be noted that the new bid does NOT include ridiculously priced fixtures like the last one did. Also, Andrew and Doug are going to cover the actual cost of upgrading the electrical service. Prior to us moving in, the building was only equipped with a 200 amp service, which is far too low for commercial usage. Regardless of who or what had moved into the space, the electrical would have still needed to be upgraded, thus making it a building necessity rather than a theater-specific modification. Woo hoo!

3. Chris, our general contractor, is going to start laying out the walls tomorrow, which means the framing should begin shortly... and that, my friends, is REAL progress. Woo hoo!

If you find yourself in the general vicinity of the Moxie on a weekday evening or weekend day, swing by and see if dad and I are hard at work. If so, run to the nearest convenience store and buy us some beer. Dad likes Coors Light, but I'll drink anything... except urine. Woo hoo!
author: Dan

comments.author: Maddy
comments.body:
In all the months of reading, never before have I had the chance to respond first.  Thus, I must delurk to take advantage of such an opportunity.

Oh yeah, good job on the theatre (I enjoy the much more pretentious of spellings).

comments.author: nicholas.
comments.body:
Best of luck.  Hopefully when I visit springfield again, I can see a cool movie.

Too bad there was nothing like this a few years ago when I was still there.

Hope all goes well.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body:
Maddy: Congratulations on your delurkment! If you ask me, THEATRE is live action plays, THEATER is midget wrestling, and CINEMA is Moxiesque.

Nicholas: Thanks for the support!

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
I always KNEW that the News-Leader, The Yellow Pages, and the Springfield Movie Theatre website were pretentious!  Now I have proof.
Transposing 2 letters does not always equal a high falutin' British dialect.  Sometimes it's just common usage! 

(Requisite smile emoticons here)

Good thing I have a sense of humour.

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body: So, do all these savings mean The Moxie's financial crisis is alleviated?

comments.author: Maddy
comments.body:
Theater-- lots of gum stuck to the floor

Theatre- no gum stuck to the floor

The Moxie- floor isn't finished yet...

comments.author: steph v.
comments.body: Yea! I want to help with renovations...or stand and watch.

comments.author: J.R.
comments.body: 'Tis more fun to simply just stand and watch.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Agh! Too many comments to reply back to... I'll answer all your questions with one word: yes.

comments.author: Evan Erwin
comments.body: Good luck on your work schedule dude. I suggest you pick up a collectable card game to raise the last of the funds, like I did this past weekend. Just think of the juicy quotes: "Playing for the money? Pfft. I'm playing for the Moxie, bitches!" "What's a Moxie?" "It's when you lose and I win."
